exemplars.name: Reid Hoffman
exemplars.track_record: Co-founder of LinkedIn, sold to Microsoft for $26 billion; Greylock partner; multiple successful investments
exemplars.constraints: Built LinkedIn from scratch with initial focus on professional networking; emphasized network effects and user value over early monetization
notable_actions: Prioritized network effects by focusing on user growth and engagement before monetization
Made strategic decision to sell to Microsoft when the platform reached critical mass
Advocated for 'blitzscaling' - rapid scaling to capture market leadership despite uncertainty
Emphasized building teams and culture as competitive advantages
Pivoted from SocialNet to LinkedIn after learning from initial market feedback

exemplars.name: Andy Walsh
exemplars.track_record: 3x founder with 2 exits; board member and strategic advisor; angel investor
exemplars.constraints: Capital-efficient scaling; remote-first team building; focus on sustainable growth over vanity metrics
notable_actions: Built companies with minimal external funding while achieving profitable exits
Implemented remote-first culture before it became mainstream
Focused on unit economics and customer retention over growth at all costs
Strategically timed exits based on market conditions and company maturity
Advised multiple companies on exit strategies and capital-efficient growth

exemplars.name: Brian Chesky
exemplars.track_record: Co-founder and CEO of Airbnb; grew from air mattress concept to $100+ billion company
exemplars.constraints: Started with no funding; faced regulatory challenges; built trust marketplace from scratch
notable_actions: Pivoted from air mattresses to full home rentals after discovering real user demand
Implemented professional photography program to build trust and improve listings
Navigated complex regulatory landscapes by engaging with cities proactively
Focused on user experience and community building as core differentiators
Made strategic decisions to cut non-core offerings during COVID crisis to preserve core business
